result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Heather A Westlund

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 2:20 Defendant Heather A Westlund in court with attorney Gregory J. Jerabek.  Danuta Kurczewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Dismissed and read-in to 15CF190.
Plea hearing on April 26, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial - 12 person on May 3, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Heather A Westlund in court with attorney Gregory J. Jerabek.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Lambert states that the defendant does not wish to make a plea today and wishes it be set back on the trial calender.  Court will put back on the trial calender and will not reschedule again.
Plea hearing at 03-17-2016 01:30 pm
Plea hearing at 02-08-2016 03:00 pm
Jury trial - 12 person at 12-09-2015 08:15 am
& Disclosure (Defendant)
Cover Letter from Atty. Gregory J. Jerabek, dated Sept. 25, 2015.

9:14 Defendant Heather A Westlund in court with attorney Gregory J. Jerabek.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Not guilty plea. Bond is continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 10:00 am.

9:10 Attorney Gregory J. Jerabek in court.  Craig Lambert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State requests warrant. Attorney Jerabek does not know why defendant is not here.
Court orders warrant. $2,000 cash bond set.
Arraignment at 09-28-2015 09:00 am
No abusive contact with J.J.

1:17 p.m. Defendant Heather A Westlund in court.  Sarah Kenas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State notes an area on the complaint, 4th full paragraph.  Want it noted for the record it was a cash bond signed not a signature bond.  Officer Todd Snyder is sworn and testifies to his employment with the Wisconsin Rapids Police Department.  Testifies to the events of 8/19/15 regarding the defendant.  The witness identifies the defendant in Court as Heather A Westlund and Court recognizes.   State enters information on case 15CF190 and Court takes judicial notice. Court modifies the cash bond.
Motion hearing at 09-11-2015 01:00 pm
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment at 09-11-2015 01:00 pm

Defendant Heather A Westlund in court.  Sarah Kenas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions regarding non appearance.  Warrant is cancelled.  Previous bond is reinstated.  Court orders defendant to report to Branch 3 to get a new court date.
of Bail/Bond Forfeiture

9:36 Attorney William Michael Lennon in court.  Sarah Kenas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State requests warrant. 
Attorney Lennon makes statement.
Court orders warrant. No bond.
Court denies motion to modify bond based on non-appearance.
Motion hearing at 09-01-2015 09:30 am
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment at 09-01-2015 09:30 am
No contact w/J. J.
Defendant Heather A Westlund in court, in custody.  Michael Daniel Zell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
